alert.note: Alert for Boone (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 12:52PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO...SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...NORTHERN DEARBORN...NORTHERN BOONE...WESTERN HAMILTON... SOUTHEASTERN PREBLE...BUTLER...NORTHWESTERN WARREN...SOUTHWESTERN GREENE AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EST... At 1250 PM EST, snow showers were located along a line extending from near Englewood to 8 miles northeast of Milan, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rapid reductions in visibility may cause travel difficulties. In addition, bridges and overpasses may become briefly snow covered and slick. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Dayton, Hamilton, Kettering, Middletown, Beavercreek, Fairfield, Mason, Xenia, Trotwood, Oxford, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Forest Park, Springboro, Sharonville, Englewood, Monroe, Trenton, and Franklin. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 24 and 28. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 159 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 19. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 13 and 57. Exercise extra caution while traveling. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
